title: Sherry: Ship of Theseus: The Paradox continues.....

posts.content:
Said to be the first signs of madness....
Talking to yourself. ..
At the moment this is the only person I can get to agree with me..
I disagree..

Not sure why Matt took the seal flange off..
I know he will be fitting the front clip soon and overlapping the flanges BUT....


Sure I am talking to myself or is there anyone there...
On Facebook get a little response...but mainly I stalk. Advised work wise not to be on there.. and reveal my foibles...

Not on twitter
Now on whatsap..
Oh technology..


G

Well I know I try to be organised so I thought about my filing system..
I used to run a desktop PC with all my stuff..For years but that was the problem...Old slow and hard wire connected to the cable router...
Then had Wi Fi..and mobile phones..
Having two boys who are savvy they always called it Dad's steam powered PC..
Now several other desk tops and several lap tops several phones and now a tablet later...I have pictures everywhere...
So I have used drop box in an attempt to synchronise and I have used photobucket..
I have folders all over the place with pictures..
Will have to get the boys to set me up with a NAS..
In the meantime..
I am dragging pictures off sim cards...and emails where Dave has sent me pictures...
Others have visited and sent me emails..
So Two mobile phone sim cards worth of pictures emerged..
Sounds like you're gonna busy uploading pictures mate

Question for others restoring vans... MIRRORS

My 1964 was a UK microbus with Devon Caravette conversion and had an internal mirror and two VW door mirrors.



When I stripped it down I removed the silentgliss curtain rail but did not notice one thing...
When Dave was painting he pointed out that there were four screw holes in the centre windscreen pillar and someone had moved the mirror.
We tried oridinary VW trim screws in the four holes and they were loose. Then I found that the mirror required special sized screws. We left all four holes...
When we put the silentgliss curtain rail back it covered two holes...
Ah Devon had moved the mirror down to put the rail in...

Too right I have around 1500 for Peebles and 500 for Sherry in my folders...
Is a right pain..because I now realise I do not have OCD...I have disOCD..
G

MIRRORS
SO..I now understand what happened and I was glad we left all the holes in Peebles.. The two OG ones were hidden anyway by the headlining ..and the rail..

In the initial posted pictures on the web and added pictures I received of Sherry the mirror seemed to sit very high and be mounted so the top edge was in line with the surface of the airbox.. and looked like this...
Maybe the initial owner was a very tall (long bodied) person...







So on strip down..
I noted ...curtains were hung by stretchy curtain wires attached to protruding rivet heads coming out of the side panels.
There are stretchy wires down the side panels and one across the bus between the B posts so that the sleeping area is private from the cab area backwards.

Sherry will have thermo mats and blackout round the screen anyway so that the cab area can be used for children on an upper westy style bench seat cot and bench seat base.
There was no silentgliss curtain around the front windscreen on a Devonette..
Designed to be a cheap model you see...

But wait..
There were no mirror screw holes in the centre pillar at all.

I knew Sherry had been repainted in a Turkis lower and a VW white on the top half and suspected the holes had been welded up or filled..
I stripped the paint off but..found
NO.. no mirror holes in the centre windscreen post at all.
But there was a mirror fitted..

A non standard mirror which was screwed up into the peak..

STRANGE..

I took pictures of the non standard mirror fitted and mused...

I did find that panel vans were supplied without internal mirrors if they had a cab division fitted...Logical if there was a load on the back the centre mirror is not much use..
Not sure what the MOT says now..
I have also found that some kombi models may also not had mirrors.
There does not appear to be an m code to either add or remove the internal mirror.
The m codes on Sherry seem normal ones..
Will have to recheck..

I was reminded of this when I found the photos of the fitted mirror.





But then I found an identical mirror fitted to Paigey's 1960 windowed bus...
I took pictures..
This is identical and with better lighting you can see the style...





So I was puzzled..
Looks like as originally supplied the March 1962 microbus ordered by Devon had no mirror and a PO fitted one..
At first I thought it had been swapped because mine had a larger mirror and an even larger clip on mirror added.

In my stash I have a VW OG one age perfect to fit..
Anyone have this experience?

Anyone else seen this style?

Clymoj?
What did your Devonette ( brother to mine) have?

The m codes on Sherry seem normal ones.. just 396 and 543...so UK spec and the normal Devon conversions camper one "without seats in passenger area...."

Will have to recheck..If there was one for no mirror...

Mine has a normal mirror fitted but I can't say for sure if that was pre its 90s resto or fitted during.

I remember it being slightly too low to properly accommodate my thermo mats but I'm not sure if that's because thermo mats are designed for later buses and later mirrors are different?
I think I have the same two m codes too but you can click on my signature to check

You do..
So maybe we travelled on the train together from VW Wolfsberg...
Or maybe you caught a very slightly later train....
....

I expect the buses for Devon were consolidated and then shipped when they had enough for a delivery..
Shame I do not have a VW certificate...
I have the m plate showing build date but I believe a VW cert shows the date the bus left the factory..
Something else I need...LOL
No want
G
